properties.Description: This site is a long established monitoring site in the Council's transport depot. The site is located off the busy A4 Bath Road at Arno's Vale and is a few hundred metres away from the southern end of the Spine Road linking the Bath Road with the M32. It is a highly trafficked area though the site is set back from the road by several metres and the sample inlet is on the building fa√ßade. The concentrations measured at the site are comparatively low because of the distance from the road. The height of the sample inlet is approximately 3 metres above ground.

properties.Description: The Parson Street School monitoring site has been operating since 2002 and was selected as a roadside site that represents residential exposure to relatively high concentrations of traffic generated pollution. The sample inlet is approximately 1 metre from ground level and four metres from the kerb of Bedminster Road where traffic queues for the traffic lights

properties.Detailed_Location: Car Park of nursery Little Bishop Street
properties.Description: The monitoring station is located within a self contained air conditioned unit within the car park of a day nursery. The monitoring station is approximately 30 metres south east of Wilder Street which is a lightly trafficked urban back street. The surrounding area is primarily residential with some commercial premises in the immediate vicinity.

properties.Description: This site was established in March 2009 to monitor traffic pollution on the busy arterial route of Fishponds Road. Fishponds Road was identified as a polluted road in 2007 and was included in the air quality management area in 2008. The monitor provides high quality monitoring data to support future air quality assessment here and will enable us to tell if interventions on the road result in air quality improvements. The equipment used is an API T200 chemiluminescent Nox analyser.

properties.Description: Roadside monitoring station beside multi-lane section of the A4044 (Temple Way). This is a major route in and out of Bristol city centre.

This site was established to replace the Rupert Street site in late 2018. It is intended to represent worst case exposure to traffic pollutants in the city centre. Monitoring of PM10 ceased in 2021 due to machine problems.

properties.Detailed_Location: Collocated with AURN affiliated site Temple Way
properties.Description: This is an "AQ Mesh" low cost sensor that is not approved by government for comparing with air quality objectives. We are trialling the operation of this instrument by co - locating it with an approved analyser at Bristol Temple Way. It monitors PM2.5 and PM10 as well as recording air temperature and humidity.
